Good idea to go on a guided bus tour first then you can choose which places you want to visit, we ended up missing a couple because we did it on the last day!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AGall0
Reviews.Content: I have visited this hotel three times in the last two years. Always very clean and quiet, excellent breakfast. Rooms at second and top floor are also extremely charming and big, while the rooms at ground floor are very small and those next to the service entry are noisy. There is no price difference really, so first bookings get the better rooms... Public transport is very close and connects perfectly both directly to the city center and on the circle lines around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Could be amazing, but what a let down”
Reviews.Author: Babelfish84
Reviews.Content: I travel for business to Amsterdam regularly and generally get booked into a different hotel by my employer. However, on this occasion a mistake had been made and this hotel was booked for me, and couldn't be refunded. The location itself is good, it's nice and central and takes about a 10min walk / 3min tram journey right into the center of town. Also, the cleanliness of the room is outstanding, can't fault it, and the decor in the bathroom is quite funky. But that's where the positives end, unfortunately. I was given room 230, and it was absolutely tiny. I am by no means big, but if I sat at the desk I couldn't even get my legs under it, or if I didn't want them squeezed the chair would be squished against the bed. No space to put anything, and while not claustrophobic, I certainly found it lacking severely in space. I was also very disappointed to find not a single room had a bath, they only had showers. The room itself was looking out to a concrete wall across and the garbage below, not pleasant at all. Also, the room was next to the service stairs, or service lift, and until late at night and early in the morning this would create a lot of noise, the walls in the rooms are very thin so you can hear everything. The bed was amazingly comfortable, but due to all this noise (also from the rubbish when it was being chucked out) sleep wasn't comfortable. Also, if you have the hotel keycard next to your iPhone, expect to go back to reception as somehow it resets it! I went down to say it wasn't working, but nobody checked my name against the reservation, they just asked me my room number and off I went again. Not particularly secure. The bar was always empty and also had no food options, a bit of a let down. Never went down to have breakfast as â‚¬16.50 for a breakfast is not really worth it, better to go to the Albert Heijn around the corner and buy some. Housekeeping was good though and I spilt some Fanta on my bed, but the next morning everything was clean again! All in all, not an experience I would repeat in its current shape, but they'd only need a few small improvements and it could be so much better! A real shame.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet, but EXTREMELY tiny rooms (even by European standards)”
Reviews.Author: markdafedman
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, although the decor is a little wild. Nice location, quiet overnight hours. Good restaurants within walking distance. The staff was EXCELLENT. Very professional and courteous. My only complaint is the rooms are tiny. Yet, you could hold a dance in the shower. Why not make the rooms larger? In order to change my mind I had to go out in the hallway...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: sheddie70
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a quiet side street just outside the main centre of Amsterdam. It is within easy walking distance of the central area of Rembransplein, Dam and Leidseplein, museum area. The hotel is well-served by public transport, particularly by tram with direct lines to the Central Station in about 10 minutes (4-5 stops) and Leidseplein (2 stops/10 mins walk). The hotel is very clean and has a modern interior. The room was well-laid out, the bathroom was clean and modern, there was a wide range of TV channels in several different languages. Quality of sleep was excellent (very quiet area) although I was woken each morning by slamming doors, whether from other guests or cleaning staff I am not sure. I did not take breakfast at the hotel. At 16 euros this appeared to be quite steep. The hotel had 1 internet terminal in the lobby, which was heavily used, and when I did have a chance to use it it was very slow. However this is an excellent choice for a hotel in one of the most popular cities in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: faraway999
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this hotel and I would recommend it for everybody, who wants conquer Amsterdam. The location near Prinsengracht is very good. It's a 15 minutes walk to Dam and Central Station. And there is also a tram station in 3 minutes walking distance. The hotel is cosy, the rooms are very stylish and well appointed. The bathroom is not to big, but enough. The breakfast is adequate to this category of hotel, but a bit expensive (â‚¬ 16,50). There are many nice cafes just around the corner where you can get better and cheaper breakfast. The whole hotel as well as the room and bathroom are very clean. The personnel is very friendly and helpful. All in all a very good hotel to a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent value hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Libby08
Reviews.Content: We booked through the Mercure's own website and secured a 50% disount, which made the hotel a brilliant price. The room was spacious, modern, clean and bright. The reception staff were extremely polite and helpful. There was a nice steakhouse at the end of the road, and the hotel was within easy walking distance of all the main sights. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of privacy and adequate room facilities”
Reviews.Author: lemaCheT
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the 3rd floor, and had a sloping roof, affecting one side of the bed making it hard to get in and out. Staff were generally ok, except the cleaning staff who ignored the do-not-disturb sign on our room, and chose to make it up anyway. We didn't want it made up, we wanted out privacy. We were out of the hotel at the time but that's hardly the point. The colour scheme of the room was a sort of lime green and a pinky colour. Sort of odd really. Location-wise, the hotel is in a nice, quiet location that seems very residential. It's close to Leidensplan, with lots and lots of restaurants, things to see and do. It's a bit of a walk from the Red Light district, but you could always get a tram. We were very upset to discover that for the rate we pay for an Accor 4 star-hotel, there was no in-room coffee facilities. A sign in the lift kindly offered it to us for 5EUR a night. That';s not reasonable at a hotel of this level.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms but mixed reception”
Reviews.Author: maimutzacelmare
Reviews.Content: The rooms are more spacious than you find in many hotels, the breakfast is excellent, and the location is close enough to everything. They were kind to let us get into the hotel early and responsive to requests. However, the hotel reception can be at best quirky, some times friendly, but some times nasty. It depends not only on the person but the manager on duty at the time. If you can ignore the reception, you will have a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “should be a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: kiwitraveller98
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Amsterdam in Amsterdam expensive! This hotel is a great price for the quality and nice and modern. The 1 euro bus/van hop on hop off that runs around and stops anywhere is very very close to the hotel and well worth using. Hotel also really close to the Heiniken factory!!! Worth staying at.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Historic Amsterdam, what a gem”
Reviews.Author: NickandEd
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in historic Amsterdam, in an old Amsterdam building, tucked alongside the canals and cobbled streets, this is the place. The rooms have the big windows and high ceilings that you expect from an old Amsterdam house. The light floods into the room. The bathrooms are a little compact, but kitted out with everything you need. The reception team are very helpful. It is a 15 minute walk from Muntplein or Leidseplein if you want tourist restaurants and bars. It is a 2 minute walk to the nearest tram stop. We ate out for breakfast, or picked up a picnic from the one of the many stores/deli's nearby. The buffet breakfast in the hotel is EUR 16 per person, but we did take up the EUR5 a day coffee/tea making facilities.

Reviews.Title: “delightfully dutch decor and witty staff made for a great stay”
Reviews.Author: latte_fan
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights in April and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again the next time I'm lucky enough to be in Amsterdam. First, the hotel is located near the outer canal rings in a more residential area. In the evening there are plenty of little restaurants and cafes to enjoy a good meal and best of all you won't be woken by traffic or pedestrian noise coming from the street. The hotel is about a ten minute walk from the Heineken Experience, Fifteen minutes from the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum. In the other direction it's about a 10 minute walk to the Floating flower market. There is a tram stop one block from the hotel which goes to Dam Square and the central train station. So overall the hotel is a good central location with good transport links if you don't want to walk. The hotel itself is comfortable with a quirky dutch design sense. The rooms are very spacious, I had a double room that I almost felt lost in due to it's generous size -- even when compared to American hotel rooms. The furnishings were plenty, rocking chair, HUGE bed, TV, mini-bar, working desk and chair, night stands, ample lighting. The bathroom was big enough to share if you're traveling with someone. The sink had a nice delft tile like design, same as the wall tiles above the toilet. The shower was decent sized, never ran out of hot water, and had moderate water pressure. Mercure supplies you with plenty of toiletires so there is no need to bring soap or shampoo. The only downfall I found with the hotel room was the lack of free Wi-Fi access. In fact Wi-FI or cabled internet access is crazy expensive at the hotel, I think around $17US for three hours of Wi-FI (you can have multiple sessions that add to three hours or use it all at once). If you don't want to pay for internet access there is a free workstation in the lobby where you can easily check email or look up anything you may need to know while staying at the hotel. Some people's reviews have mentioned the reception staff being rude or not friendly but I found the exact opposite. Hans (on the desk in the morning) in particular was cool -- with a witty sense of humor and the ability to speak a million languages what's not to like about him. The other two reception staffer's that I sopke with were helpful, they anwsered all my questions and filled any requests that I made during my stay. I didn't have breakfast in the hotel as I'm more of a coffee and pastry person in the morning so big breakfasts are wasted on me.

Reviews.Title: “Low key. Good location. Quirky decor.”
Reviews.Author: craig_traveler
Reviews.Content: They took a Merc ure chain property and droped in in a quiet, side street location, differentiated it with modern quirky furniture, and created a great hotel experience. If it weren't for the small Mercure Hotel sign, you wouldn't even know the hotel was there. Walking distance to Heineken Experience, Albert Cruyp Market, Museuamplein, and you can walk to Dam Square in about 20 min (or take the 24 tram). Staff pleasant, and I was promplty checked in to a double on the third floor. Room had modern conveniences, including large bath, fridge, flat screen with international channels, and a windw with shutters. Several wifi options are available, with the cheapest being the broadband connection at the desk for 9 euro per 24 hours. There's a small bar downstaris, and a breakfast room which is simple, but ample.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Nice staff and cute rooms”
Reviews.Author: Yosoylatina
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property on March 12 - 15 with a friend. Staff was very nice, although no one offered to assist us with our bags. At the entrance, there's a small flight of stairs and the elevator is tiny. They have a computer in the lobby where you can surf the internet for free. Or you can purchase wifi time via T-Mobile HotSpot in your room...you can buy by the hour and split up your time during your stay. Front desk manager was nice enough to print out my train confirmation when asked if they had a printer (which they do not have a public one). Room was okay...not huge but not tiny. It was comfortable for us. Location was wonderful. We were within walking distance of the Heineken Experience and the main street to catch the tram. There was a supermarket nearby, coffeehouse around the corner and some places to eat. It cost us $11 for a taxi ride from Centraal Train Station to the hotel. I would definitely stay here again. We didn't do the breakfast so I have no comment to offer on the food.

Reviews.Title: “Agreable hotel, but AWFULLY RUDE reception staff.”
Reviews.Author: Rewier
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mercure Amsterdam Arthur Frommer for 3 nights in January 2010. We stayed many times at Accor hotels before (whether Sofitel / Mercure or Novotel) and never had to complain. However, Mercure Amsterdam Arthur Frommer deserves one. It took us 25 minutes to check-in, as the receptionist was being rude to a guest instead of trying to help and confort. This caused the guest to complain even more. She was not kind with any of the following guests, including us. Guests in front of us were Gold members and asked for an upgrade. She replied with a straight rude 'no ugrade, sorry'. We asked for a basic info, she replied she did not know. Rooms are good and modern, positions was excellent, in the middle of some of the nicest canals. At check-out, again, a receptionist, this time a loud man, was rude to a guest that complained about high extra charges. Apparently they charge EUR 20 for parking, EUR 5 for internet., EUR 10 for coffe in the room. Again only 1 receptionist and 6 guests checking out. Some guests wanted lo leave baggages at the hotel for a while. Considering the queue, the receptionist could have collected them, and deposit them later. On the contrary he rudely inticated the way to the guests, left the reception, and went with them to a store room very far away. When he came back, looking quite distressed and upset that the queue was getting longer, he entered a room, to exit after a minute. He kept speaking so loud that everybody could hear all other guests: name, surname, details of nights stayed, minibar, movies watched. In short Agreable hotel, but AWFULLY RUDE reception staff. Will not come back.

Reviews.Title: “Smashing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Larafro
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel - it's not posh, it just does the essentials really well. The location is great - about 20 - 30 minutes walk to the Old Town and 10 minutes from Leidesplein or Rembrantsplein. It's in a quiet residential area so not much traffic or drunken reveller noise. Rooms are small but nicely decorated. The staff were always friendly and helpful. Breakfast was tasty. All in all, Â£300 for a double room for 3 days including breakfast seemed like a damn good deal. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Budgie1975
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just south of the centre of Amsterdam and is easily arrived at on Trams 16, 24 or 25 from Centraal station (the stop to get off at is Wetteringcircuit). It appears to be in a very safe area. The hotel is only a 5 minute walk to the Heineken Experience. The service we received for fantastic. Hans, on the main desk, was particularly helpful. The rooms are cosy but then you are in Amsterdam so you will only be sleeping there. Only two issues with this place - firstly you can only eat in the hotel at Breakfast time - there is no room service or restaurant. The second issue was that Tea and Coffee making facilities are not provided as standard so you are charged â‚¬5 per day for a kettle etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: evandstace
Reviews.Content: The location is great. A safe area close to public transport, Bars, Restaurants, The Heineken Experience and a supermarket. The rooms are bright, warm and have friendly feel. Free internet is available in the lobby and the hotel staff are friendly and helpful. It's hard to pick faults with this hotel.. The only thing we could think of was that breakfast was the only time you could eat in the hotel ( especially when it's snowing and you don't want to leave)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the decor, very clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: SimiReading
Reviews.Content: I love staying in Mercure Hotels. This one was great - it was so so clean, so so comfy and easy walking disance to everything you need!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Local Feel, Decent Price”
Reviews.Author: SFOtravelguy
Reviews.Content: Location: Tucked away from main street, the hotel really feels like part of the neighbourhood. Very quiet and quaint. It's a great location, not too far from anything. Easily accessible from three tram lines, 16, 24, 25. At night, after clubbing, if you don't want to wait for the night bus, you can always walk home as well (since Amsterdam is very compact). I was clubbing in Leidsplein area and walked home in 15-20 mins. In the morning, Every morning, I walked 5-10 mins to Munt-Plein (Flower market) and had breakfast along the canal there. Cleanliness: Very clean and recently remodeled so toilet fixtures, beddings, TV, desk, etc are all in great condition. Room/Computer: I was in 308, their top floor, so I had a slanted roof. I have no problem walking around, but tall people might hit the ceiling. There was a PC in the lobby for everyone to use free of charge. Value: Hotel prices tend to be higher in AMS due to its limited availability. Mercure provides a good balance between value, location, and facility. Overall: Very happy with my stay, a cozy room without that boring hotel feel.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget place”
Reviews.Author: od1n13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Nov 2009 and although the colour schemes are a little bold, we found this place very good value for money and a good all round hotel. The 3 person room we stayed in was a decent size, clean, and well maintained. The only potential issue was the rather small corner window, which did almost nothing to light up the room (althogh this was acceptable and I belive ours was the only room with the unique window, due to it's postiion on the building corner). We didnt try the breakfast, but it seamed very nice (and expensive at EURO 16.50). I would happily return to this hotel and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel -- price and location”
Reviews.Author: thegfd42
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Orbitz and got a great deal. While the room I stayed in was a little small, I was thoroughly pleased and very satisfied with my stay at the Mercure. The rooms (as others have mentioned) were clean, and the linens were relatively new. I thought the bed was very comfortable as well. The location is pretty convenient to wherever you want to go in Amsterdam, and I felt very safe in this neighborhood. Don't expect 5-star accommodations here, but if you want a decent hotel that will make your stay enjoyable, I would definitely consider this location. Next time I go to Amsterdam, I will certainly look to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A very relaxing and comfortable experience.”
Reviews.Author: LondonMorgana
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been a favourite of a friend and mine since 2002.The manager and staff go out of their way to help. The rooms are comfortable,always clean, warm in the winter and cool in the summer. The staff in the breakfast room work very hard and are very courteous.The receptionists are friendly and any problem is quickly resolved. The main barman is a mine of information and knows his trade very well. The location of the hotel is in an excellent area and near to trams. This is a hotel not to miss in a city which we love. David and John, London.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: deckchair26
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really well situated, close to Heineken Experience, museums and a few nice restaurants, as well as being an easy walk from the centre of amsterdam. The whole hotel was nicely decorated and our room was small but very comfortable and clean. The staff were very polite and helpful but we had little reason to ask them for anything. Our only problem was that the room was always too hot for us and the AC didn't seem very effective. Also, the deal we'd booked didn't include breakfast but they were going to charge us a whopping 33euros for breakfast for two people everyday. Luckily they didn't quibble when I said we hadn't had any breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fair service, but not a great value”
Reviews.Author: rpolicicio
Reviews.Content: I have previoulsy stayed at this same hotel before with 2 friends and our triple room was fine. Good decor, good beds... this time, I came back for a double room and had a somehow negative surprise: room was much smaller, with a much poorer decor... and very very very noisy - every single morning, we were woken up by the continuous noise of doors, cleaning... really unpleasant. We did get an early checkin, which was great, but the staff was not pleasant with us at all - made crystal clear to us they were doing us a big favor. And that continued during the whole stay. Lobby was recently renewed and looks much better - but not a very good taste, I would say. The room was small, but fair - good equipment, good bed. Bathroom was small as you expect in Europe -and had the basics. Just an important note to women: they do have a hair dryer but it's crap. So if you need a dryer, better take yours, because that things if just for them to put at their website they have a hair dryer. They do have ONE single PC you can use with internet access - but many sites are bloked. And I mean regular sites - I couldnt access my email because the site was blocked (it's my company's public website), and I guarantee there's nothing pron or not appropriate there. Staff just told me there was nothing they could do. At the end, I could at least print my boarding pass there, at least... Price was not cheap, so it's definetly not a good cost benefit relatoinship. The only excellent thing is location - between the center and the museum district, near cannals... really nice location. At the end, the experience showed us that the management and staff really do not care about guests' experience - all those details that show they care lack, at all levels.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in middle of city near lots to do”
Reviews.Author: Caroline604
Reviews.Content: Hotel is near Heineken Experience, restaurants, coffee houses and more. Hotel was clean, front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Room was small based on US standards but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near museum quarter”
Reviews.Author: griseldis
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Mercure Arthur Frommer in Amsterdam in June. I had a pleasant stay. The Mercure Arthur Frommer is situated in a quiet street near the museum quarter. It is just a 10 minutes walk away from Paradiso, Melkweg and Leidseplein (for those who like to enjoy nightlife). The hotel is relatively far from central station, though (30-40 minutes walk through Amsterdam city) but there is a tram stop for tram 16 and 25 on main street not far from the hotel to get you there. My room had a modern design hotel feel (black and white art deco style with a touch of pink) and was very clean. Nice modern bathroom, too, large comfortable bed (nice sheets, good mattress) and flat screen tv. Very large windows that, unfortunately, could not be opened. I also missed an electric hot water kettle but this was a minor inconvenience. I highly recommend this hotel and would return any time. (Old hippies out there, go on a sentimental journey, spend a night at the Paradiso and then chill out at Vondelpark. And visit the Hash Marihuana Museum. There are some lovely old things on show).

Reviews.Title: “Safe, reasonably priced hotel in a nice area”
Reviews.Author: gnftr66
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of package deal and it turned out to be a very pleasant hotel. The location was very good and within easy walking distance of everything. The street was very charming. The hotel was clean and the room was a good sized. There is nothing so special about this hotel, but if you are looking for a safe, reasonably priced hotel in a nice area of Amsterdam, then stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for exploring Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: crossman
Reviews.Content: We took our two children to Amsterdam for a few days in March and were really pleased with this hotel. It is in a great location - a quiet side street away from hustle and bustle, but within easy walking distance of plenty of things to see & do. The hotel was very clean & the staff very friendly, particularly towards the children (who incidentally loved the artwork in the room). The tv able to receive BBC was an unexpected bonus for the kids. Breakfast was typically European but plenty of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nathpek
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel from trip-advisor recommendation. Great choice, best location, very nice and quiet street. The service is very effective. The room was clean and spacious. The hotel was recently renovated and everything is new. Breakfast and breakfast room - a must. In summary, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Alright location, refurbished rooms”
Reviews.Author: silverwolf22
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a canal belt and easily walkable to the main attractions - the Heineken Experience, Anne Frank and the Rijks and Van Gogh Museums. Its not in party central, which means quiet nights. Also there is a tram stop nearby on the main road. I had no problems getting around Amsterdam from this base. The reception is currently undergoing renovation, which isn't pretty. Hans checked me in and he was courteous and welcoming. The double room was small, but pretty good value for Amsterdam standards, and the new furnishings were lovely. The walls were painted a dark blue, which may not be to everyone's taste but the look went well with the coloured carpets and decor. Lots of restaurants in the area, and there are cafes, a deli and a bagel shop just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet convenience”
Reviews.Author: doc50
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very quiet side street (providing you avoid school coming out time!!) but a 2 minute walk from the tram stop, or a 10 minute walk from the centre. As other reviewers have stated at present the reception was being upgraded but the staff when we were there were extremely friendly and helpful, including letting us use the computer at reception to check in our return flight. The rooms are larger than London average, in intersting (zany?) style, ours was green and red with clear 60's style furniture! Breakfast was an excellent choice, eat all you like. For a city centre hotel, not expensive, quiet and convenient, recommended

Reviews.Title: “Too dark, difficult internet connection,”
Reviews.Author: BRFlyerSP
Reviews.Content: Actually I liked the location, on a quiet residencial street, and liked the style of building. But the good part stops here... I hated the room decoration. The first room I occupied had a brown and blue painting, very dark and tight. Never felt so bad in a hotel room. Internet connection didn't worked with cable, and wireless was T-Mobile, wich I could not use because don't had a T-Mobile phone and could not use credit card for paying the service due to company policies. I finished using the desktop PC near the frontdesk... After complaining about internet I tried another room where the connection still didn't worked but I could get free access from a hotspot and the room was better, with more space and "lighter" green paint. The building itself is charmy, with the help of a good IT pro for fixing the internet problems and a good decorator or architect to redesign the rooms it can get quite better. At least new carpet and paintings... Meanwhile, I would never get back...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in awesome location”
Reviews.Author: JenM7
Reviews.Content: We found the Mercure because of it's association with Novotel - it exceeded our expectations and was a great value for a family with small children. Great location near the Heineken Experience, beautiful and spacious room, very helpful staff. It's very hard to find a single room for 2 adults and 2 children, but they can accomodate with advanced notice. We made reservations online and got an awesome rate, but didn't know if they'd have a room for 4 until we arrived. Fortunately, a room with 4 twins was open. There was plenty of space, even with all those beds! Breakfast was filling, although their regular dining room was under construction. The only down side was the street noise from below - but that just helped us get up earlier and get on our way.

Reviews.Title: “Great ambience”
Reviews.Author: FrankOFile48
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Situated in a very quiet residential street within easy walking distance of most of the major tourist sites in Central Amsterdam. The welcome at reception was very warm and amusing (being told the room was the only one where it is advisable not to be drunk upon entry!). The room was immaculate and very comfortable but a little cold to begin with due to the heating not having been switched on, but this was soon rectified. The bar is very pleasant and spent a very agreeable late Saturday evening in the company of the barman and a Norwegian engineer. The tranquility is marvellous compared to some other Amsterdam city centre hotels I have stayed in. I will definitely use this hotel in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for seeing Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: UK1000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and wanted a nice hotel to use as a base when sightseeing around Amsterdam. It was ideal for us! We got a tram from the central station and then a short walk to the hotel. The hotel is tucked away on some residential streets, so nice to be away from the hustle and bustle. Our room was a good size - big, comfortable bed, ensuite shower room (small but newly refurbished). We were out and about sightseeing so only came back to our room to sleep, but had a good stay and would definitely recommend it. The bedrooms are nice and fresh as have been recently refurbished. It was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “newly renovated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melb1985
Reviews.Content: the Mercure Arthur Frommer hotel was fantastic.....we booked a triple room which had 3 single beds. the room itself along with the hotel seems to be newly renovated, the bathroom was really nice and the beds were extremely comfortable. the location wasnt the best as it was around a 15-20 minute walk into central Amsterdam but the area itself had some nice cafes and bars where you could relax.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice room”
Reviews.Author: chunich
Reviews.Content: Made my reservation on Accorhotels.com. If you have a firm schedule you can save some money (non-refundable fixed date). ROOM: Reserved for a 3-person room (#108). 2 twin beds plus a third folding-bed ready to sleep. Space is limited for 3 people but that's fine for us to save $$$. Our room faces the little street, which is very quiet at all times despite being on the first floor. Bathroom is huge with a shower. Big mirrors and plenty of bathroom accessories. Only wish they had a shower curtain. But it's still awesome. It has a LCD TV with remote. Fridge with drinks in it. A desk with lamp. Big closets and an extra pillow in it. LOCATION Location is just fine. Amsterdam is smaller than it looks on the maps. You can walk to the Central Station easily in 20mins. Or you can take any tram that goes to that direction (#16, 24, 25). Tram station is just outside, right in the middle of stations Keizersgracht and Weteringcircuit. Trams are always available. Never had to wati for more than 15mins. STAFF/INFO The room was reserved under my name but I arrived late. They let my company check in first without much trouble. Staff have been helpful and there are resources for tourists at the front desk. Hotel has wireless available with credit card, unless you have subscribed to T-mobile's hotspot program. SURROUNDINGS If you get off from Tram at Weteringcircuit there is a little diner that opens until 12am. Try it's Doner sandwich, it's really tasty and cheap :) Overall we are very happy to have found this cheap(er) option of lodging in Amsterdam. Because everything is not too far away, it's well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: AlbertodC
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through flying blue miles for 3 nights for me, my wife and my 16th months' son. Everyone was really very friendly, the rooms are extremely clean and nice, breakfast rich and of very good quality and the area, where the hotel is, very quiet. Also it is located close to the centre of the town and we could reach all the places we were intereseted to visit by foot, which was very important especially considering that we were travelling with a small kid. End of the day we were very happy about it and, in case we are back in Amsterdam, this hotel will be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “A great night!”
Reviews.Author: Dave G
Reviews.Content: This property was my first stop after an all-night flight. They had a room ready for me at noon when I finally crashed. This property is just about finished with a thorough remodel. My room was great (two single beds is always a surprise to an American!). The bathroom was brand new and clean. The walls and carpet were freshly updated. I would have loved to have stayed here for my entire visit. It's located a block off of a main street, which makes it nice and quiet at night and it's far enough away from the seedy downtown area that you get a feel for the real Amsterdam. A very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Looked better on the website than in person.”
Reviews.Author: mckaykarenj
Reviews.Content: We booked through Airmiles to stay 2 nights at this hotel. The Airmiles pictures definitely make the hotel look more luxurious than it is in person. The fixtures and furnishings in the bedroom are ready for refurbishment and the bathroom needs a deep clean. The location is ideal for exploring Amsterdam and there are tram links close by. Don't hail a cab unless you can speak Dutch because we were truly ripped off; I don't think the taxi driver realised we had been in Amsterdam for a couple of days and had walked the road numrous times when he took the scenic route and charged us E15 for what should have been a 3km journey. The breakfast buffet at the hotel is good - healthy and fresh with plenty of choice, but don't expect service with a smile. General value for money was about average, I reckon.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Doneit49
Reviews.Content: Good location, quiet, yet within very easy walking distance to the main shops and bars and restaurants. Trams 16, 24, 25 run from close by to city centre tickets can be purchased from most shops. Trams are every few minuets, so you are never waiting around for long. On arriving at Schiphol airport, and not knowing our way around, we went to the tourist information desk and bought a return ticket for the shuttle bus, which took us right to our hotel. If you have never been to Amsterdam before like us, then I can recommend you use this or you may never know how to get to the hotel. For 19 euros it was easy. The hotel staff are all very helpful and polite, the rooms are basic and well maintained, and not bad size wise, which were cleaned every day. They have a free safe deposit box, T V with some English channels as well as Dutch. The bathrooms are average in size with shower, however the showers do not have doors, and water goes all over the bathroom floor unless you turn the shower head against the wall, but there is always plenty of hot water. Continental breakfast, with a good variety on offer. Part of the hotel is none smoking, which suited us fine. You must buy a good map, donâ€™t rely on the small free maps that are given away. Always be careful of the cyclists, they donâ€™t give a dam and seem to have right of way, they donâ€™t bother to stop if you get in their way. The Anne Frank museum is well worth a visit, but be warned, itâ€™s a very moving experience. The Heineken experience is also a must. For 10 euros you get about 3 hours of fun and drinking. We certainly had a good time at the Arthur Frommer, and can recommend this hotel to the more mature traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Much”
Reviews.Author: ERigby
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good location. Very friendly staff. Cons: Hotel is run down. Clean, but need some attention paid to it. Room was really small. Located in an alleyway, which made getting home at night a little scary. Bottom Line: Basic hotel if you're looking for something cheap, but I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Noiisy and run down hotel in sweetlocation”
Reviews.Author: Marginwalker
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the location of the hotel, but the room had a very worn out, dated look to it, and the bathroom was ridiculously funky. The carpet seemed unclean, the blankets and pillows very old and uninviting. Most annoying was the low level of sound proofing in the facility--this is a good hotel for people who don't mind the sound of doors slamming day and night. Many of the guests seemed to have little regard for others' sleep; there was lots of hollering out in the hall. The windows could use improvement, as even on the quiet street we faced, there were motorists and drunken revelers passing by in the wee hours of the night. While some of the desk clerks we encountered there were helpful and professional, one was downright rude about giving directions to the VanGogh museum upon our arrival and another was curt and impatient. Breakfast was just so-so; we only ate there once and preferred to walk to Village Bagel on the main street. Unfortunately, the main street leading to Noordestraat was all torn up and under construction, which gave our approach to the property an industrial, unpleasant feel. But once we wandered through the canal streets east of the hotel, we fell under the spell of Amsterdam. We wished we'd opted for a hotel on a canal, with a little more charm. The Mercure Arthur Frommor was just utilitarian.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: uncletony
Reviews.Content: We (me, wife and adult daughter) stayed three nights in this hotel in mid-April. We were allocated Room 108 which we suspect normally had two single beds but the management had put in a roll-away bed as well. All the beds were fine and comfortable. Linen was changed for the third night. There were some cobwebs and dust visible on the high picture rail, quite a few marks on the walls (from suitcases?) and grubby paintwork around the light switches. All this made the room look a little worn and shabby. The air conditioner didn't seem to cool the room, just blow air around on what was a temperature record breaking weekend (27C). The clean, bright bathroom was huge with a proper full-size bath tub with over-bath shower. The sink/vanity unit was okay, and the towels were clean, fluffy and changed every day. The free in-room safe was a good asset. The mini-bar was well stocked, but the contents didn't entirely match the printed list. There is no tea/coffee making facility in the room. From previous reviews we elected not to use the expensive hotel breakfast bar but to eat at a small cafe a few hundred meters south of the hotel on the main road - that was fine. The bagel cafe mentioned in reviews looked good. Note that the Persian restaurant (the Teheran) mentioned in previous reviews is now closed and looking very derelict. Staff were helpful in providing maps and calling taxis. Although not in the downtown central area it is generally within walking distance of most tourist sights, and easily accessible using the 16, 24 and 25 trams from/to Centraal Station. The car park is small, max imum 7 or 8 cars. In summary the hotel was perfectly adequate as a place to shower and sleep. We booked through Expedia and paid EUR118 per night (incl taxes). Yes, we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: DevonWinelover
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel set in a quiet street. Could not fault the customer service from beginning to end of our stay. Room quality is good for the price. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Quiet, Clean”
Reviews.Author: JAthens
Reviews.Content: Great location if you are in Amsterdam for a few days. Clean and quiet neighborhood. We used trams No 16, 24 and 25 in and out all day (trams stop at Wettering Cirquit which is a 2 minute walk from the hotel). You should buy a - 24h or 48h or 72h - discount pass (available at Central Station) because it saves you a lot and can also be used for buses (including night bus). Breakfast is continental buffet and we felt it is overpriced for EUR15 pp per day - even if they can serve it to your room. Try walking to the bagel corner spot which is 3 blocks north, on your way to downtown - locals feel at home there, you should too. Or, walking south, try breakfast at the caroussel right on the Wettering Cirquit, you cant miss it. In other words, if you really dont need breakfast in bed, then there is something for you within walking distance. We are satisfied with the reception desk service. They will spend time with you to make sure you are happy with the information, they will offer alternatives and book almost anything for you. They will store your luggage if you need that on your last day. When we brought in an applepie and asked for utensils they responded in no time. The room (we stayed at 222 non-smoking) was clean - and they kept it that way. Room temp was fine, we never felt cold. It was rather small but we never felt we needed more space. The mini-bar was ok and fairly priced. No problem with the bed. Bathroom has no tub, but 24hour hot water plus bath amenities make up for that. Good space for your clothes. Also, laundry service availability - at a charge. Free safe, we liked that. Not much of a room view, but we did not care for that. TV with limited options but who visits Amsterdam for that. There is no restaurant in the hotel. There is a steakhouse right outside with very tasty food, but the steaks couldnt get any smaller - prices ok though. The persian restaurant nextdoors offers much more for less and surprizing good quality, we would eat there again on any casual occassion. Good reasturants you will also find near the meusem square. You will notice a very small pastry shop on your right, just around the corner, walking north to downtown. It is considered one of Amsterdams best. Do buy sth, you wont regret it, all those locals flocking in every afternoon cant be that wrong. In Amsterdam, do take some time to visit the south part of the city (city meaning the greater Amsterdam area, not just the centre, buy yourself a real map), the most expensive real estate there, along a great park with lakes. You will be happy to lose the bar scene and coffee shop picture that so wrongly profiles this city and notice Dutch people on their daily activities - we felt they are lively people with broad interests and we were very happy to have met some of them. Outside the city, take a tour or two to the country, yes it is pricey but - hey- you get to be part of the real country for a change. If we were not to upgrade to a 4* or a 5* next time we visit Amsterdam, we would stay at Arthur Frommer.

Reviews.Title: “Grat weekend location”
Reviews.Author: ATJP
Reviews.Content: Our group of 14 despite our late friday evening arrival were welcomed efficiently & checked in quickly to our small clean ensuite rooms. The buffet breakfast is adequate with eggs & toast made to order. The hotel is in a quiet location but in easy walking distance of all the main sights. On saturday evening our group enjoyed dinner at the local steakhouse recommended in earlier revies. food was good & cost reasonable. On checking out we were able to store our luggage at the hotel & enjoy a full day on the sunday. At the end of our stay all were happy with this 3 star hotel & would recommend to others planning a weekend in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel with cozy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Proxification
Reviews.Content: Located in one of the quiet streets of Amsterdam, its a really nice Hotel. Rooms are small but cozy and very well designed. Affordable hotel with all amenities and conveniniently located near tram stations. Not far from Canal boat station too. Overall highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel for the dollars”
Reviews.Author: DKVogel0810
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a hidden area off of Noordestraat - but not so hidden you couldn't find it. Once you arrive in Amsterdam Central train station go to the front of the station and take tram number 24. This tram will take you to Wetering Circle which is where you will get out. Do not stop at Kerkestraat(sp) it is much further. The reason is that there has been a tram eliminated (no 25) from service due to the construction on a new part of the metro system. This construction is due to last until 2011. Once you get out at Wetering Circle backtrack one street. Look down the avenue and you will see the Mercure sign - it truly was easy to find. I would not suggest having a car - there are only 6 spaces in front of the hotel. The front desk staff was very nice and helpful. They are able to book "Key Tours" from the hotel desk. This was very nice as we did the "Dutch Countryside Tour". It was a six hour tour. My suggestion is that if you have a day - do the Grand Holland Tour - it is 8 hours and includes the Delft, Rotterdam, Hague. The hotel rooms are small - but typical Europe size. About 10x10 plus the bath. There are no washclots so if you use one - you should bring your own. The room was very clean. The showers have no doors so the floor tends to get a little wet if you point the sprayer in the wrong direction. The hairdryer worked great - which is unusual for a hotel. We were in room 302 and it was pretty quiet - we had another relative traveling with us - in room 307 and he said it was noisy all night long, doors slamming and people yelling. With regards to the breakfast - they have a continental breakfast at the hotel. It is really not worth the 15 Euro they charge. However, there isn't much close around for breakfast so we had it 2 mornings. There is cold cereal, juice, coffee, pastries, coldcuts and cheese, fruit on one morning. They will make you eggs - you have to specify what kind. They are mediocre at best. The front desk will sell you 48 hour tram passes, they are a good deal - unless you buy a strippenkart from the bookstore at central station. There are a few coffeeshops right around the corner for those of you interested and a great Italian place recommended by those at the hotel front desk on the main street past the tram stop.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poppi_MB
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good and clean. Itâ€™s a 5 minute walk to Flower Market and other attractions, so very close to the city centre, but in a quiet street. There are plenty of nice restaurants and bars nearby. Staff at reception were helpful and friendly. The only weird thing is that the cleaning lady knocked at the door at 9:30 AM (on the 2 mornings we stayed there) and within one second she was inside the room â€“ not very good for privacyâ€¦ Apart from that everything else was fine. Would stay there again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice, good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: bushytailedfox
Reviews.Content: This is a funny hotel, because even though it's part of the Accor chain, it hasn't changed into one of the bland, neutral hotels that seem to be springing up all over the place. It is a very traditionally decorated hotel i.e. dark carpet, wooden furniture, patterned curtains and bedspread etc, but I really love it! I travel a lot with my job and stay in a lot of hotels, most of which are the modern ones I mention. I don't find anything wrong with them, but I find this one very charming. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful, the rooms are comfortable, the mini-bar is great value (and has chocolate and crisps in it, yum), very well located (although I would have to rely on the others on here, as I only go to my office and back)! They do a breakfast, and I always have this brought up to my room - they are incredibly prompt with it and it's the traditional continental breakfast - a couple of rolls, cheese, ham, croissant, jams, apple, yoghurt etc, but always does the trick for me. They also have BBC1 and 2 on, tragic of me to be so concerned I know, but especially if you're away on business on your own it can be very helpful to know these things! The bathrooms are fairly small and don't have a bath, but the shower is large (not the most powerful, but it does the job) and always toiletries and plenty of towels. I don't know what it is that I like so much about this place, but I always have a good stay, never have problems and would thoroughly recommend it on that basis. Incidentally, the area is very quiet as it's a residential area, but if you do want to make sure, ask for a room which doesn't overlook the car park, it's only small but it's where the main doors are so you will hear people coming back from nights out etc. 2 restaurants within 1 minutes walk - a steakhouse (very popular) and a Persian restaurant next door to it - went in here one day because the steakhouse was full and have been going back ever since - great food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and quiet location”
Reviews.Author: only1eebo
Reviews.Content: I would agree with most of what the previous reviewer has commented on. The selling point is the lovely quiet, off the beaten track location. The walk into the major area of the city is only 10 mins and covers a route that has many less touristy restaurants. The hotel itself appears to have been rebranded as Mercure in the last few years, and I can imaging that it would have been a quaint private hotel in days gone by. The reception staff were great on arrival (room ready at 11am) but a certain recptionist named Bruno was pretty stressed when I checked out, blaming me for giving him the wrong room number for my account when I spoke clearly and even handed him my room pass with it written on. He was also 'huffy' about storing our bags for 4 hours before we left, even though they had the facility and we had checked with other receptionists earlier. Apart from him, the staff were great. I would stay here again, but I would use the Bagel shop around the corner for breakfast and I would drink at the Marybelle bar opposite the French Consulate (on the main road in the direction of the 'Tehran' restaurant).

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: uklad79
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a couple of times. The hotel is basic for the cost and so much more could be done with it based on its great heritage. The hotel doesn't offer much by way of facilitys, expensive breakfast and a small dingy bar but the rooms are comfy dispite being very basic but have some charm about them. The loctaion is the best thing as it's in a quiet residential area next to a small school yet it is only a short walk to all the main areas. That is the main reason I always choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: picalil
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel in late March, and found it to be really agreable. It is in a perfect location - tram stops are a few minutes walk from it in either direction - to Leidseplein or the Dam and all other tourist attractions in between. Or if the weather is nice (it was freeezing last week) you can easily walk to everywhere. Hotel staff were pleasant and helpful, the room was a decent size, with comfortable beds, tv, mini bar, and large shower room. Breaksfast room/Bar was a decent size. Can't fault the hotel at all really.. would throuoghly recommend as it is very comfortable. In a good location, but also benefits from being in a quiet street away from the hustle and bustle. Would thoroughly recommend. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: tommo2k
Reviews.Content: Good quality hotel, just as expected from Mercure. Good value for money, clean, very quiet, curtains cut out light totally allowing a nice long lie in and there was a lovely steakhouse restaurant just down the road which seemed popular with the locals. Close to 2 tram stops into the centre, but only a 10-15 minute walk if that doesn't bother you.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean and with amenities! (a/c in all rooms).”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe the prior posts. My experience in this hotel was excellent! CHEAP, CLEAN and with FRIENDLY STAFF. Clean air conditioned rooms, bathroom including amenities (soap, shampoo, lotion), very friendly staff always willing to help you with directions and maps and well located (1 1/2 block away from the nearest tram stop). A grocery store is 1 block away, a couple of restaurants are about 160 feet from the hotel and the Heineken Museum is a short walk distance. This hotel is now part of the Accor chain hotels. Maybe those awful experiences I read in the prior reviews happened before this Mercure Frommer hotel acomplishes the Accor standard. I totally recommend this hotel for young people with a controlled budget.

Reviews.Title: “Dont' take notice of other reviews!”
Reviews.Author: fairylights456
Reviews.Content: Can't believe the two reviews I've just read. Just returned from Mercure Amsterdam (April 04) and it was fine. Staff very courteous, most comfortable large double bed I've ever had in a hotel, clean, etc. Also clean WC and 'wet style' shower. Nice white fluffy towels. Only thing wrong was no tea or coffee making facilities, but they had satellite TV. Hard to find hotel though, when you arrive at airport, train to Amsterdam Central and then Tram 24 or 25. Just ask, ask ask! the natives are friendly. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mercure Arthur Frommer this summer and the temperature went up to tropical hights. It was hell at night altough they claim to have airconditioning. The barman was smelly and was asking for a tip! Brutally! To make things even worse: the night porter was drunk!! I complained to the manager but she tried to blame me!! Never, never, never stay at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Mercure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Why do the advertise with a/c when they switch it off at eleven in the evening? When I complained to the night-receptionist I could't understand a word he was saying. I think he comes from Pakistan or something. The general manager did't listen to my complaint she was more interested in her ugly little dog.

HotelInfo.Name: Mercure Amsterdam Arthur Frommer
HotelInfo.Address: Noorderstraat 46, Amsterdam 1017 TV, The Netherlands
